text: Pittosporum turneri, commonly called Turner's kohuhu or the tent pole tree, is a species of plant in the Pittosporaceae family. It is endemic to New Zealand. P. turneri was first described by Donald Petrie in 1925. The species flowers between the months of October to December. P. turneri is threatened by possums. It is regarded as being Nationally Vulnerable. ==References== turneri Category:Endemic flora of New Zealand Category:Conservation dependent plants Category:Near threatened biota of Oceania Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Pittosporum turneri
